1. AAPI individuals have a lower recidivism rate compared to other racial groups. According to a study by the National Institute of Justice, AAPI individuals have a recidivism rate of 27.6%, which is lower than the national average of 33.0%.

For example, many AAPI communities have a strong focus on education and career development, which can help individuals gain the skills and resources they need to avoid returning to prison.
4. AAPI individuals are less likely to face discrimination and bias upon release from prison. Overall, while all of the races listed have their own unique strengths and challenges, AAPI individuals are more likely to be successful as reformed prisoners who will never commit a crime again due to their strong support systems, access to resources and opportunities, and lower recidivism rate.
